Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a bed when sight-seeing.”
Reviews.Author: FGBLondon
Reviews.Content: For my latest visit to Paris I needed somewhere cheap and central. Hotel de l'Europe is both. Situated a short (2 minute) walk from Gare du Nord it was perfect to let me get around the city easily. It is most certainly NOT a 5-star hotel. In fact it's not even 3-star, but it is clearly in a process of regeneration. The reception and communal breakfast area is modern, bright and clean and there's free wifi access in the lobby too. The accommodation itself is less impressive. I had a twin room with en suite. It was small and dark (as most rooms in a converted French city house are) and the view was... the building behind the hotel, but seeing as you can't sight-see Paris from your hotel window, this didn't really bother me. The en suite was functional with a shower cubicle so 'compact' that it would certainly dissuade you from over-indulging on the croissants. The room and corridor had clearly been recently painted, which made the room brighter and there was also a TV, should you want it. The bed itself was not great. It was very soft, like sleeping on a sponge cake and the concept of duvets has not made it there yet, so sheet and blanket is all you get. Despite this, the room, bathroom and bed were clean and cleaned daily, which is about as much as you can ask for in a cheap 2-star hotel. The best feature was the staff. Every single one of them was friendly and genuinely helpful, speaking clear French (for those of you who can) and good English (for those of you who can't). Breakfast (coffee & croissant) is available in the lobby for about 7 euros. I didn't have it, but can thoroughly recommend the Brasserie Terminus Du Nord which offers coffee, pastries and tartines (baguette, butter and jam) for the same price but in lovely traditional brasserie surroundings and allowing an excellent spot for people-watching early in the morning. All in all, the hotel is satisfactory if you just want somewhere to sleep. It's in a very convenient location and affordable. It's not really ideal for a romantic weekend but if you just want a (soft) bed for the hours inbetween tourist attractions then it's more than OK.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel in the trip”
Reviews.Author: Ricardo F Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel to stay for a night, close to Gare du Nord and easy to access the airport. Arriving late we discovered our room was in the 5th floor, the lift was out of order and we had to carry our luggage upstairswith no help. The room was dirty and the bathroom worse: walls falling down, carpet needing a dust cleaning,... I felt insecure done to the lack of a inside locker in the door.

Reviews.Title: “Remember You Are Not Booking A 5 Star Property”
Reviews.Author: Thespena K
Reviews.Content: Originally Stayed late December to early January My mother and I stayed at this property for about a week while we were in Paris. The property itself is very outdated, do not expect much from the decor. The rooms are not big but that's generally how it is in Europe - so for me and my mom it didn't come as a surprise. If you are looking for more spacious and bright rooms then do not book here. The washrooms were of a good size, mind you the have the older versions of sliding doors for their showers - so when you close the door it leaves a crease in the middle and the floor may get wet while you are showering. So just put a towel down before showering. The bathrooms came with all the essentials - you just have to open the mirror and they are all there. The corridors on all the floors have lights but due to sensors will turn themselves off when it realizes no one is walking by - so just flip the switch as you are turning into your corridor and it will automatically turn itself off after sometime (green initiatives). The property is situated on a busy street and close to a hospital - so some nights (even though they have sound proof walls and windows) we could hear ambulance sirens from time to time - but after a full day seeing sights and shopping we were too exhausted that we slept right through them. There is no safe in the room - so we just locked most valuables in our luggage and that was fine. You do leave your keycard at the reception before venturing off - this again was no surprise as most hotels in Europe ask of the same. The staff and owners are very very nice and helpful. They gave us great recommendations for places to eat and which form of transportation to take to reach our destination. The location of the property is excellent once you sort of get use to the surrounding areas. It feels like it would be a bit dodgy at night but it is safe. You are about a 5-7min walk from Gare du Nord - which metro trains can take you to every part of the city. When you do arrive at Gare du Nord, understand it is a very very busy station and also a bit run down. People will be rude and unhelpful, but if you try speaking a bit of french then have a tendency to be more willing to communicate with you - rather than you starting your sentence off in English, it's just how it is in Paris. Another great thing to being so close to Gare du Nord is that it is the station that offers multiple trains to Brussels, Belgium a day. If you are looking to cross another city of your list - you can take 1.5hr train to Brussels which I highly recommend just for the day. Located basically right in front of the hotel are many bus lines that - and it takes about 20-30mins to get into the city (depending on traffic). We didn't try the breakfast at the property, around the area you are situated there are amazing traditional french restaurants that offer the most amazing food for breakfast, lunch and dinner. My advice is to stay at this hotel if you don't mind a bit of an older property and are if you are on a budget. It has a great location with lots of great places to eat. Very close to the Montmartre district and Moulin Rouge as well and about 20-30mins away from central Paris.

Reviews.Title: “My advice? DO NOT STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: alevb
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at this hotel for 4 nights (5-9 November 2011) on the internet. The hotel website looked fine, and the rooms also looked fine: http://europe-paris-hotel.com/ It was pretty easy to reach there from Charles-De-Gaulle airport. The moment I arrived in Gare du Nord was a huge disillusionment. It was not the Paris I had imagined. (Later, I asked other Parisians and they told me that it is the worst district in Paris. So, beware.) When I arrived at the hotel, the receptionist did not ask me for my identity/passport/reservation confirmation. He did not ask me to fill in a kind of form during check-in. So, if something bad happened, no one could prove or see that I stayed at the hotel. This wiped away all my trust. As I was a solo traveller, I had to be extra extra careful. Anyway, I went up to my room, and saw that there was no light in the corridor, I had to strive to find a switch. Finally I found my room. It was a stinky, stuffy, badly-decorated, tiny room. I went to the bathroom (no towels, no shampoo, no soap). There was a long semi-transparent window in the bathroom that people could see you (though blurred) from the outside. Then I went back to the room, opened the window, the view was dirty rooftops very nearby. And I could see a woman taking shower right across my window (half-blurred window). I checked the bed, saw that the pillow cases were dusty and dirty. One more thing, you cannot lock your door when you're inside the room. You just shut it. And believe me in a hotel like this, it does not make you feel secure. When you go out, you have to give your card back to the receptionist. It was around 9 pm; I was tired, hungry, totally uncomfortable and unhappy. So I decided to leave my suitcase at the hotel and have something to eat. One hour later I went back and decided to leave the hotel. I told the receptionist and he charged me 2 nights. This annoyed me greatly, because he insisted that I stayed that night, when all I did was to leave my suitcase inside for only 1 hour, and that he could not find someone to book for the other day, so I had to pay for 2 nights. DO NOT STAY in this hotel, if you have got some respect for yourself.

Reviews.Title: “not bad, could find better for the price”
Reviews.Author: sameer k
Reviews.Content: room clean , but a little bit small for the price that is being charged.hotel staff is very nice and helpful. well situated very close to gare du nord and gare de l'est.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER STAY IN THIS PLACE”
Reviews.Author: ciphernzilch
Reviews.Content: This is one place that should be avoided at all costs. Although the owners were nice initially, it not an experience that we will remember. The room was very tiny, barely any space to even keep our luggage. It was quite hot inside the room and when the windows were opened, it was very noisy. The breakfast is just one croissant and a piece of bread with a glass of orange juice and coffee/ tea. That's all you get, however hungry you are. They also retain the room keys and never allow us to take it with us, which is something that we have never experienced. On the last day, we had gone out shopping and were a little delayed in checking out. When we came back to the hotel, we found that our luggage had already been brought down without our permission. They wouldn't even let us check the room once again. As a result, we did not find some of our clothes, a power adaptor and a few other things. Overall, not worth the money that we paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Well located, well looked after.”
Reviews.Author: Marion16
Reviews.Content: We had an enjoyable stay at this hotel. Initially there was a hiccup with the booking, (print out your emails and have them with you!) but the management dealt with this very postively. The breakfast was unspectacular but adequate, there was always someone available to help, the location was great - very close to the Gare du Nord - and overall I would definitely consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Paris and the Hotel de L'Europe ... a perfect match!”
Reviews.Author: AllStations
Reviews.Content: It is located close to Gare du Nord. The staff were fantastic.They were very helpful and gave me some great travel tips around Paris. The room was clean.the bed comfortable and it was very quiet. Had a very nice French breakfast at this hotel. Plenty of good cafes nearby. A great hotel for your Paris vacation.

Reviews.Title: “great location, great price, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: akaluski
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great deal. The rooms were nice, it was close to the metro and the staff was friendly and helpful. It was a little loud at night because the hotel was on a major street but Paris is a city so this was not unexpected.

Reviews.Title: “Really really loved it and hope to be back.”
Reviews.Author: DRebeiro
Reviews.Content: My stay at Hotel de l'Europe went very, very well. Jean-Jacque, his son Nicolas and all other staff are friendly and helpful. The room, bathroom and all areas are spotless clean. Great place to live. I would recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless night”
Reviews.Author: tony_leonie
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel due to its proximity to Gar du Nord. The location was ideal only a few minutes walk from EuroStar. A nice welcome from the owner and his sons but unfortunately downhill from then. The lift was not working for our 4th. floor room so hard negotiating luggage on the narrow staircase. The room was OK for a 2 star hotel but overlooked a very busy and noisey street. No aircon so faced with the option of closed windows and baking or opened windows and being deafened. We chose the later and hence the sleepless night.

Reviews.Title: “Nice downstairs - it goes downhill from there....”
Reviews.Author: FlannoUk
Reviews.Content: The reception area was clean and bright. The staff on reception were friendly & helpful. The breakfast was good & tasty. Thats the downstairs bit - and it was nice. The rest: was pretty poor. Room was run down & grubby. Aircon didnt work. TV was barely adequate. The bed was uncomfortable. The shower was small but adequete but the toilet leaked badly. The street was very noisy but I had to keep the windows open because of the lack of aircon. Didnt feel too good the next day as I must have ingested a huge amount of carbon monoxide. I didnt see any other rooms so I dont know if I was lucky but wouldnt recommend the hotel on my experience

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for your Parisian base.”
Reviews.Author: Rocketfrogs
Reviews.Content: Nestled between Gard du Nord and Gard De L'Est train stations, Paris is yours! Excellent fresh food markets Marche St Quentin across the road, views to Sacre Coeur and plenty of cafes and restaurants closeby. The rooms are comfortable and clean though perhaps need a bit of a revamp, but if you are spending your waking hours in your room why are you in Paris? Continental breakfast is fresh and tasty and Dad and his boys at the front desk are friendly hosts.

Reviews.Title: “Great location + nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Mai_ccs
Reviews.Content: we stayed 5 nights at this hotel simple, clean and pleasant, in summary we find these pros and cons PROS: - Free WIFI in the room! this is priceless to me! - Very close to the RER B station Gare Du Nord (Subway lines 4.5 and several bus lines), only 2 blocks away in a quiet and good atmosphere - Large room for Parisian standard, approx 12m - Lift that always works - Staff very friendly, very helpful and Anglo speakers - Common facilities and room in good condition CONS: - Bathroom very small, only 1 person at a time - Double bed very poor, small and thin mattress - Rooms with doors fairly close together This hotel is recommended if you want to move easily through Paris and pay a very reasonable price, but do not recommend that you choose if you need a larger bathroom or a bed if you need larger and higher quality Bon voyage!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect transit hotel near Gare du Nord”
Reviews.Author: rpaditya
Reviews.Content: We arrived on the Eurostar from London and left the next morning by RER to CGD for a long flight. We spent the night at HÃ´tel de l'Europe in a room that was spacious, had a nice bathroom and was sparsely but comfortably furnished. The staff was very helpful (Bus Route 30, caught in front of the hotel, takes 40 minutes to Trocadero, across from the Eiffel Tower) and friendly. The wifi signal was strong in the room but the connectivity was unreliable as it would stop sending traffic and the staff had no idea on how to fix the problem, which they admitted, with the router. We did not have the breakfast. The price was right.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money and location”
Reviews.Author: TaylorsAustralia
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel over 30 years ago-it was a good basic hotel then and it is even better now. I spent 3 nights there in a triple room with my 2 young adult daughters. The room was spotlessly clean. The location is 3 mins walk from the Gare du Nord. The staff are really lovely and helpful. I booked using their online reservation rates. They seemed very reasonable. I would recommend this to anyone on a restricted budget-great value for money.

Reviews.Title: “good value, okay for a night or two”
Reviews.Author: RangeviewRay
Reviews.Content: We wanted a hotel close to Gare du Nord for an early departure, and chose the Hotel de l'Europe based on other TripAdvisor reviews. It is a 5-10 minute walk from the station, neighborhood is okay though not totally comfortable after dark. Front desk staff spoke english and were friendly and helpful. The room was clean, the bed was very comfortable. Our room was away from the street, facing the courtyard, so there was almost no street noise BUT the walls are thin and the hallways are noisy. The lift and the hallways are very small, it would be a challenge navigating these with large suitcases. The stairway is a steep spiral staircase, don't bother trying this with luggage. We left very early so can't comment on the breakfast. The room is small, there isn't any sitting space other than a small desk chair. It would be okay for a night or two, but cramped for a longer stay I think. We would stay here again, although we might also investigate some of the other hotels closer to Gare du Nord.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean, close to the Gare Du Nord station”
Reviews.Author: Karlz977
Reviews.Content: Very close to the Gare Du Nord station, just 5 mins walk. I was in a room on the backyard, very silent. New forniture, clean room. Internet had problems, the wifi was ok but I guess they had problems with their provider. The staff was completely unhelpful on this point.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there!”
Reviews.Author: collinsCrowborough
Reviews.Content: The male receptionist was untidy and unhelpful. The lift, which was like a broom cupboard, was up three or four steps and this man just stood and watched as my husband, who is 75, and I, struggled with our suitcases and the lift door. The bed was not comfortable and we shared the room with at least two mosquitoes which bit us repeatedly. The shower doorway was so narrow that I had a problem getting in and out. There was no soap and the hairdryer had been taped together. The street was very noisy but we had to keep the windows open because of the heat. We were on the 5th floor but the polution from the cars below was awful.The breakfast was not bad. The bread and croissants were fresh and were served with butter and jam. The coffee was pretty tasteless but hot.

Reviews.Title: “It was affordable and ok”
Reviews.Author: MissNadzy
Reviews.Content: This place was great. The staff was nice and helpful. Yes, we did later realize there was ants in our room so we decided to stop hoarding our food indoors and kept them on the balcony since the night were cooler. I would stay here again when back in Paris. It was close to everything we needed and wanted.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: DonaKarp
Reviews.Content: We have been in this hotel for 5 nights. You could hear everyone walking up and down the hallways. There was a lot ants in our room! Very old and darning sheet, one set for 5 nights! Mould in bathroom. Dirty wall papers. No air-conditioning, so at night it got very warm and you had to leave the window open (mosquitos). When we asked for ironing service they don't have it. Only one croissant and a piece of baguette, a small pot of jam a small pot of tea or coffee for breakfast. There is no tea or coffee making facilities in the room or in the hotel. Hotel area is very creepy and stinks of urine! Gangs of black men hanging around. I'm beging you stay away from this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “FULL Unbiased Review - please read”
Reviews.Author: LMG99
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Gare Du Nord the hotel is 3 mins walk away so perfectly placed for the station. However.................. I didn't feel comfortable walking around the area particularly late at night, for example we arrived early evening and headed straight for the hotel, it had been a long journey we were hungry and thirsty so decided on this one occasion to buy a take away on route. Gangs of young black men hang around the street corners and outside bars and restaurants. I went into a takeaway called "Quick" the French equivalent of McDonalds I think (and the food is just as bad! but it fills a hole!) anyway, just as I was leaving a young black guy came in, nothing wrong with that, however he watched me take my change something like 35 Euros and then immediately turned and and walked out. When I got out of the shop he approached me asking if I wanted a smoke I said no he then put his hand on my shoulder and muttered somthing like which football team do I support. Needless to say I made a quick exit towards the station.... it was not a pleasent experience and it i not the nicest of areas. OK the hotel....... what you get for your money is a room with a bed (or beds) and a bath or shower onsuite and thats all. The rooms are cleaned every day (no complants) , yes its a bit tatty the decor isn't the best the beds and the carpet have seen better days the TV has one english channel, there is no tea or coffee making facilities in the room or in the hotel (outside of breakfast). However I wasn't there to sit in a hotel room watching tv and drinking coffee I was there to see Paris so for me the hotel served its purpose and for the price I cannot complain. Ah I can complain! the noise from inside was deafening cause by people opening and closing doors during the night! and I'm deaf!!! (actually my wife will tell you I have selective hearing) :) I didn't try breakfast so cant comment. If this is your first trip to Paris be warned its expensive...very expensive. Cappuchino (5/6 Euros) the norm so I bought a kettle for 12Euros. If you are travelling with a baby then its a nightmare travelling. for example the Metro - very few stations have escelators (I didnt see any lifts), next time I may try the bus service! Similarly very few restaurants have highchairs (I think here in the UK its so easy to find restaurants with highchairs, maybe I expect too much!) and the baby changing facilities were none existant!! most of the restaurants are tiny so getting a pushchair in at all is difficult and once in you are always left with the impression that you are in the way and the quicker you leave the better. One plus point on the hotel they did allow me to use the microwave in the hotel to warm the baby's food. Incidentall no cots! Talking of pushchairs I remember thinking how on earth do people in wheelchairs cope! the place was a joke in this respect! I know I sound like I have a downer on the place I dont I loved Paris!! however next tiime I will be better prepared. Will I stay at this hotel? probably not I didnt particularly like the area. I did however dine at a restaurant DEGRES DE NOTRE DAME ( lesdegrehotel.com) which was great and reasonably price food three course lunch for 12.50E (Try it!) and they were great with the baby! The hotel if anything like the restaurant will be good. Thats it Pairs great, hotel serves its purpose (for singles and couples...children no) :)

Reviews.Title: “Value for money, clean and accessible”
Reviews.Author: johnplaer
Reviews.Content: Its a good value for money hotel. 10 minute walk from Gere d Nord. Clean hotel, friendly staff. Breakfast contained cereal, lemon cake slices, orange juice, french bread, croissant, butter, jam, (tea/coffee). Enough for a light breakfast. Breakfast served from 7-9am. Do try to be there around 7-730 otherwise you might get 'not so hot' water for tea. There is a noise from the road when room windows are open but windows are double glazed so these keep the noise out when closed. Mosquitoes have a tendency to come into the room when windows are left open, so don't leave windows open when you leave the room. I would recommend taking your own shampoo and shower gel. No need to take hair dryer. The shower size was 2' x 2', so if you are a fat person and you dropped the soap on shower floor while taking a bath, you just cant bend down and pick it up while you are in shower. Perfect hotel if you have a low budget and want to roam around Paris and come back to hotel to spend the night and go sightseeing again in the morning. I would highly recommend this hotel for everyone who wants to go to Paris on a budge trip and wants to spend night in an accessible hotel which is neat and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, price, ambience”
Reviews.Author: vivutah
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and another couple stayed at this hotel in September. We had previously stayed there in 2008. It is 1 1/2 blocks from the Gare du Nord train station and operated by a very amiable family. The employees/family are all fluent in English, very friendly and most helpful. I had lost luggage for 5 days and they made phone calls for me and gave me free internet access to track my luggage. The staff recommended great restaurants with very reasonable prices within walking distance. The Paris Hop On Bus stops nearby. The Gare L'Est is within 3 blocks. We paid 75 euro per nite excluding breakfast but paid for breakfast one day and found it very good and reasonably priced. The rooms are clean and bathrooms ensuite.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this place at all costs. Be warned. It is truely awful”
Reviews.Author: ozboyz
Reviews.Content: I had the unfortunate misfortune of booking this hotel online using one of those on line last minute hotel booking sites. This was also done in conjunction with speaking with one of the sites representatives, and after checking the hotels own website. We arrived at Gare Du Nord station after transferring from Charles De Gaulle airport. On our arrival we had to find the hotel, which although what appears to be quite quaint Parisian streets actually gave us the feeling of insecurity due to the type of people who were walking around. They all looked shifty and not at all pleasant. We found the hotel and entered the small reception area off the main street. The young man at the desk was lovey and very friendly. He checked us in and directed us to the lift, which was up about five steps. The lift was like a dumb waiter. Room for two suitcases and two people only and then it was a very tight squeeze. We had to close the gated doors to the lift ourselves. After a very rickety ride to the floor our room was located on we opened the door to be greeted by two rather old and tatty single beds. We entered and were mortified by the peeling wallpaper, the mouldy bathroom, and the window which looked out onto the street which could not be shut. The noise was overwhelming. The carpet was growing a life form of it's own. We sat down, forced ourselves not to cry and gathered our thoughts, and within five mintues we were back downstairs checking out. The nice young man asked what was wrong, and I told him that the place was a dump and that it was totally disgusting. He kept asking what was wrong and I told him that I had to check out as there was no way we could stay at this hotel and that it was so horrid that there was just no way we were going to stay there. During this he had called for the manager and I had logged onto the internet in the reception to try and get the hotels web site up so that I could show them the nice rooms they were displaying with the trendy wood floors and the almost Ikea style rooms. When the manager arrived he told me that there were rooms like this but they were more expensive and that I had not booked this style of room. I was so over the whole experience that I just said to him that there was no way I was paying the extra for a room as I just felt the whole hotel was a shamble and that I had to get out. So I did just that. I left and jumped into a taxi and went to the Ibis at Montmatre which was a much more pleasant and safe area to be in. In the defense of the manager, after contacting the booking agency with whom I had booked the hotel, they spoke to him and he refunded two of the nights out of the three that we had booked. This is of importance as they have a 72 hour cancellation policy so by right they did not have to do this. So be warned. This really is a horrid place to stay and I cannot emphasise this enough. If you are prepared to look furthur afield there are much nicer alternatives out there. Also unfortunately since I was only there for a matter of minutes I was unable to take any pictures, but there are some already here on trip advisor which show some of the horrors we had to face.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and perfunctory”
Reviews.Author: elhoskins
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very clean (a bonus for Paris) and easy to find and in a great location between the Gare du l'est and nord. Extremely basic - tiny bed and room and a little bit above a hostel really. Quite loud (in the buidling) not from traffic etc. Also it was Â£79 per night which seems extortinate for what you got? But the people were lovely and it was exactly what we need arriving late and leaving early. Breakfast was good - croissants and rolls plus some cereal ( a life saver for me - i am a healthy eater and it is hard when you keep getting bread products).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for Paris”
Reviews.Author: MidlandsUK85
Reviews.Content: The room was large, airy and spotless; the bathroom amazingly free of the eccentric plumbing arrangements that can make a stay in Paris rather less fragrant than it should be. The shower was powerful and plentiful. Breakfast was no-nonsense but completely satisfactory. Staff very pleasant. The best hotel of this kind that I have stayed at in the city.

Reviews.Title: “Simple and adequate”
Reviews.Author: Chomboner
Reviews.Content: A lovely hotel with very friendly and helpful staff. Situated within walking distance of Monmatre, the Gare du Nord and the Pompidou centre this place is a clean, basic, cheap way to stay in Paris. Everything is very simple but with a balcony looking at the Sacre Coeur for the price I paid I was very happy.

Reviews.Title: “Clean tidy hotel, great location, good breakfast”
Reviews.Author: greenbean3
Reviews.Content: It was refreshing to arrive at this hotel and find it was as good as the reviews indicated. We arrived quite late and the front desk was still open, the room was a bit small, but had two large windows that opened to provide some fresh air, had a very nice modern bathroom, and the bed was very comfortable. The staff were very friendly and welcoming, and the breakfast was good (orange juice, croisant, bread, butter, jam and your choice of tea, coffee or hot chocolate). The location was fantastic, only a few minutes walk from Gare du nord or Gare d'Est. We left our luggage there on the Sunday then came back and picked it up for the Eurostar train back to London. We walked back from Montmatre on the Saturday night, it felt a bit sketchy around Montmatre but was fine near the hotel. No problems at night between the metro and the hotel. I would definitely recommend this as a place to stay, especially for Eurostar weekends away!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: Lindsabebay
Reviews.Content: I don't know what the other people leaving comments on this hotel were thinking. Our stay was completely awful! The room was small, moldy and smokey smelling. It was also loud. You could hear everyone walking up and down the hallways, in their room. The police sirens run up and down this street several times a day and night. Every time someone else flushes a toilet, you could hear the water run down the walls. It was creepy. The internet was supposed to be included and it was 1 euro per minute which we happily paid the first day and then the internet did not work the three more days we stayed. The ONLY redeeming value of this place was that it was located very close to two train stations in Paris. Don't stay here.

Reviews.Title: “It was OK”
Reviews.Author: ElmoTheCat
Reviews.Content: This is an inexpensive hotel near the Gare du Nord. The location was convenient. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. The room was OK - kind of a dump, but it was clean. We could hear the street noise in our room, but it was not overpowering. The neighborhood is eh - spend your time elsewhere and come back to sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Dodgy Area”
Reviews.Author: Meagan73
Reviews.Content: The Hotel was nice and the staff was friendly. We had a beautiful large bathroom with a view of the Sacre Coeur. Beds were definitley comfortable enough - small lift which isn't so great for claustraphobics staying on the 7th floor. The area that this Hotel is in, is it's worst feature - We were trying to find out way back to the Hotel from the Metro at around midnight and found it to be a very creepy area - lots of homelessness too. Walking down the street you would see faeces that at first I thought was from a dog but realised quickly that it was from a Human.

Reviews.Title: “Good value near transportation”
Reviews.Author: rnathan
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel to be a short walk from Gare du Nord and Gare de l'Est. Both stations have excellent public transportation. One of us did not enjoy the small breakfast, but otherwise the hotel served us very well, especially the elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rajhemworld
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel and much better than our expectations, Mr Baur and his team were too good and did everything possible to make our stay pleasant, excellent location , clean rooms, and the room on te 7th floor had nice balcony witha view of the Sacre Cour. Very Safe and friendly, wld recomend this for couples and other guests also

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: B123Belfast
Reviews.Content: First and foremost, I can't believe a well-known travel agent would give their customers the choice to stay here. WHY WE BOOKED HERE: We seen a last-minute deal through Thomson and jumped at the chance to go to such a wonderful city at such a good price. We looked up the hotels website and were quite impressed with the pictures it showed and the hotels amenities, so we went ahead and booked. However, once we arrived we soon realised the pictures on the website do NOT look anything like the actual rooms! CHECK-IN: Check in was very easy and the member of staff was very helpful and very fluent in english. We found the other members of staff to be pleasant. THE HOTEL ITSELF: The reception and breakfast area is very clean and we had no complaints about this. However, its once you approach the stairs to go up to your room, that you start to panic. The carpet on the stairs was tearing away from the wall and looked dirty. You walk up a few steps to the lift, which is approx 5ft X 2ft. Its the smallest lift I have ever been in and it just fits comfortably 2 average size people and 1 suitcase. Disabled people would have no easy way of getting to their room. Once out of the lift, the corridors are riduculous. Dingy wallpaper and yet again more tatty red carpet. Our room was situated at the end of a very dark corridor. Very squeaky floorboards!!!! There was a WC on our floor and my partner went to look in it and found a thong lying on the floor. Not a good impression for a guest. THE ROOM: The room itself was an average size and was big enough for the double occupancy. The bed was bearably comfortable but we weren't expecting luxury. There was exposed pipes running down one wall and everytime someone from the room upstairs flushed the toilet, you could hear the flushing down the pipes and the vibrations it made. The room door I didnt feel was safe. There was a latch lock near the top that had been broken off and there was no actual lock on the inside (however, when you went out of the room and closed the door, you couldnt open it again, so it was a little reassuring!) There was no air-conditioning so at night (espec in july/august) it got very warm and you had to leave the window open. The bathroom was a diaster. It was so small you couldn't even get dressed properly after having a shower. The shower was also very very tiny. There was bits of mould around the ceiling and on some tiles, as there was no fan to let the steam from the shower escape. So when you took a shower the room was absolutely roasting. EXTRAS: There were no extras at all in the room, which would probably be expected from a 2 star (i'm not quite sure!) - but I thought there would have at least been soap in the bathroom... but no! CLEANLINESS: The bed was clean. There was wallpaper peeling from the walls though. The bathroom was clean too (toilet/sink) apart from around the corners of the ceiling where small bits of mould had started to form! The reception area was immaculate! If only they put the same effort into their rooms!!! SERVICE: The staff were very helpful and were able to speak very good english. We asked about a safety disposit box and were told that it was a safe hotel but there was a safety deposit at reception if we needed it. The morning after we arrived, we heard a guest asking for his valuables to be put safely away, the reception staff member took the belongings and placed them in an unlocked cupboard, which i presume was the "safety deposit box" so we ended up having to lock our valuables in our suitcase. BREAKFAST: This was very simple but it was expected of a european hotel and a 2 star one! We got a piece of baguette, a croissant, orange juice and coffee. My partners orange juice was served in a glass which was cracked nearly a third of the way round near the bottom. LOCATION: The hotel was very handy to the Gare du Nord where connections to the airport and central paris were very easy. Distance from the station was around 5 mins walk. There were alot of beggers and homeless people around this area so its not the nicest of places. However, the cafes/bars opposite the entrance to the station are very nice so I'd recommend you give these a try. The hotel is situated on a busy road so its very noisy during the daytime (but this doesn't really matter because you're out!). At night, it seems that everyone with a motorised scooter comes out and races up and down that road, so its difficult etting to sleep. The warmth of the room made you open the window but then you got the endless noise of scooters and police/ambulances. The website says there's "soundproofing" of the walls. Nonsense. OVERALL: If your looking for a one night stop-over or if you're REALLY well and truely strapped for cash, then this hotel might just do the trick. But if like us, you're looking for a romantic getaway for a week, its well worth looking into another area (I suggest Notre Dame!) The hotel is in a conveinent location and the condition of the hotel is very very basic. It's rated a 2 star but I would only give it a 1. It needs a lick of fresh paint, new carpet n the removal of mould in the bathroom!!!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient base for tourists in Paris”
Reviews.Author: BrissyGirl-in-London
Reviews.Content: We found this family run hotel perfectly located for our 4 day stay in Paris. We were a party of 1 x adult & 4 x teenagers and were situated in 2 interconnecting rooms that were seperate from the rest of the accommodation with our private staircase entry. Reception staff was very polite & helpful at all times. Rooms were clean, comfy, air-con, with good sized bathrooms however the view from the windows left alot to be desired - straight into neighbouring rooms! The included breakfast was very basic -hot drink, orange juice, a croissant, a baguette with condiments. We actually opted to eat out one morning as the teens were starving. It's a short easy stroll from the Gare du Nord with many patisseries and cafes along the way. With buses at the front door & several Metro stations close by, getting around was easy.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect - apart from the weather!”
Reviews.Author: kebabs
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in December 2007 and again June 2008. Staff remembered us and as before were all very helpful. Room was exactly as we expected and overlooked Boulevard de Magenta. With a bit of a twist I could see Sacre Coeur in the distance. Breakfast was included in our pre-booked rate and is a good start to the day (basic continental style but perfectly adequate). Now the weather:- We have been to Paris many many times but never experienced overnight temperatures in the high 70s. It was so humid, it was difficult to get cool. Sleep was a non event as the hotel does not have air-con. It hasn't put us off though - and I'm sure we will be back in the winter.

Reviews.Title: “More than 2 stars!”
Reviews.Author: Gracilis
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my boyfriend at his hotel and I recommended it for couples. The desk staff was very friendly, they have internet service. The room was clean, light, organized with a nice bathroom. It has 2 big metro and RER stops in less than 5 minutes walking. The breakfast was too simple, just coffee, juice, croissants and bread, so you better want to eat in all the restaurants that are close to the hotel. The location is ok, in the 10e neighborhood. You can reach Paris down town in 5 mins by metro. Walking distance to the Sacre Coeur Basilica, my favorite place in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Would NOT recommend.”
Reviews.Author: SeasPlaces
Reviews.Content: Medium on the location. Train station nearby but also some sex shops. The word that described our room was "noisy." Noisy elevator, plumbing, everything. The door was warped, allowing light and viewing from the hallway. It also showed signs of forced entry. Quite small room; smaller than many we have been in, even in Paris. To illustrate the quality of the service and place, there was a light bulb hanging by its wiring through a ceiling can light and down in front of the shower door; so upon exiting the wet metal shower door would strike it. Didn't sleep well, at all, and had difficulty with getting the manager to wipe out the rest of the reservation. Other hotels nearby at better rates, much quieter, cleaner and more helpful. I could not believe the other reviews on this place. Wow!

Reviews.Title: “Already re-booked for this year!”
Reviews.Author: Doris7270
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay at this hotel so much we booked again for June the day we got back. It has lovely, friendly staff and the hotel is spotlessly clean. Central to everything with the nearest metro (Gare Du Nord) a leisurely five minute stroll away. Would highly recommend this hotel for visitors to Paris. Mr & Mrs Carter

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: JSLN_HongKong
Reviews.Content: This is the second time my wife and I stayed in this hotel since last year. We like this hotel because all the staff in this hotel are polite and helpful, especially the management staff. They provided us patiently with information on Paris's resorts and some interesting things in other adjacent cities. We also learned some French languages from them, which made our trip in France funnier and happier. This hotel is in a good and convenient location. It takes about 5 minutes on foot to Gare du Nord which is an interchange train station where you can take Metro and RER, etc. A market, supermarkets, sandwich shops, cafes and restaurants, etc., where you can find many things you need and like, are also within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Neat clean budget hotel.”
Reviews.Author: AtmaToronto_Canada
Reviews.Content: Very good budget hotel. We will definitely stay there on our next visit. Though the room was small it was clean. The owner and his sons very helpful. The train and metro station were close by. Over all it was a good experiance for an older couple.

Reviews.Title: “Not my favourite hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Mr_Nomad
Reviews.Content: I'm usually very positive about places I stay as I spend a lot of time researching them beforehand. I needed a single room for one night and came across this one. The hotel location is great, being just round the corner from Gare du Nord station. However, the room I was given was very small with a double bed that took up most of the available floor space.The bed was an old mattress which was cold, lumpy and a bit smelly. They did seem to be skimping on the heating and I was cold all the time especially in the bathroom. The windows were either poorly double glazed or not double glazed at all, as the street noise below was quite noticable from the room. Breakfast was served in the downstairs hallway and the portions limited. You are brought a plate of food (a croissant, a piece of baguette, a bit of cheese and a small pot of jam) and a small pot of tea or coffee. I much prefer to help myself from a buffet, so I was not too impressed by this offering or the slow service. The staff are very polite and helpful but on the whole I felt that it wasn't enough to compensate for the overall poor quality of the hotel and for me it represented very poor value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location Friendly Clean and Tidy”
Reviews.Author: Darren W
Reviews.Content: This was my 2nd visit to Hotel de L'Europe in 2007, i was so impressed the first time i returned with my parents. Being 5 minutes walk from Gare du Nord and Gare du L'est it is perfectly located for easy access to all Rail and Metro links, and is ideally situated for walking to all major places of interest, shops, bars and restaurants. The hotel is clean, tidy, has a friendly relaxed atmosphere and is exceptionally well run by Mr Baur, his family and staff who were extremely helpful even with my limited french vocabulary. We agreed the hotel was ideal for a visit to Paris and we will all be visiting again very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Jetlagged-Oldies”
Reviews.Author: Jetlagged-oldies
Reviews.Content: Both times my wife and I stayed at this friendly family operated hotel we were more than satisfied. Only five minutes walk (with a suitcase) from Gare du Nord rail staion, Paris, it is perfectly situated for all site-seeing. The building has an interesting design with a central spiral stair-case and service elevator ; small but clean funtional rooms; a quiet lounge/breakfast area, and reception staff who cheerfully give assistance with a friendly smile. Non smoking rooms are available. Great value for money and we would definitely stay there again. We recommend this hotel to all travellers in the medium price range who are looking for comfortable, clean and quiet acommodation near all the main attractions Paris has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “I was glad we have found this hotel”
Reviews.Author: AlexVal_2007
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel with our 22 months baby for seven nights. It is a family run hotel, and my wife and I we would like to thank Monsier Jean-Jacques Baur, Nicolas and his brother FranÃ§ois for all their hard work to create a very hospitable atmosphere. We also would like to thank Madam Chrislaine who is in charge for the cleanness in the rooms. We enjoyed every moment there, and would recommend this hotel to everyone, and definitely we will stay there next time in Paris. Alex, Louisa and Sophie Valentine We rate this hotel as 5+ for each criterion.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel de l'Europe - 10 Arr.
HotelInfo.Address: 98 Blvd de Magenta | 10 Arr., 75010 Paris, France
